content: corner to corner frog by sharlene my favourite crochet stitch at the moment is traditional corner to corner c2c stitch it s fast and relaxing to work i have challenged myself to try different ways to use c2c rather than just blankets and this is my first soft toy pattern a fabulous frog the pattern does not cover the basic c2c technique which is covered in detail on lots of places on the net but i do cover all the panel construction assembling and the sewing needed i use the c2c method of ch3 3dc about the design this frog toy is constructed mostly from c2c panels in order to allow successful stuffing of the toy i have designed the panels to be used as coverings over an internal structural body and limbs the internal body section consists of 2 stretch fabric panels and 2 pieces of wadding that are hand stitched together and turned through the body is then partly filled with doll pellets and finished with polyester fill the limbs are formed from chenille sticks coated in wadding and then wrapped in stretch fabric panels this pattern would be great for using waste materials like old clothing that could form the internal panels and scrap yarn that could be used as fill finished size for the smaller frog using 8 ply yarn and 4mm hook my finished toy measures 50cm long * 16cm wide * 10cm deep gauge is not important with the pattern and materials swaps will result in different dimensions for the larger frog using 10ply yarn and a 5 5mm hook my finished toy measures 70cm long * 20cm wide * 15cm deep materials required for smaller frog  4mm hook  dk 8 ply yarn weight in acrylic yarn about 120g of main frog colour i used bargain store knitting yarn brand in stallion lime plus a small amount of each of the following colours red for bow tie yellow for eyes and black for mouth  2 *14mm safety eyes 1f this toy is for a small child make yarn eyes for larger frog  5 5mm hook  10ply yarn i used spotsaver yarn from spotlight 200 g ball of main colour i used peacock plus a small amount of yellow for eyes and red for mouth 50 g of main scarf colour i used pumpkin and scraps for scarf trim i used cream  2 *20mm safety eyes 1f this toy is for a small child make yarn eyes both frogs also require  wadding about 50cm square  polyester fill  small amount of doll stuffing pellets if this toy is for a small child omit pellets  stretch fabric to make body in colours that complement yarn i used a small amount of yellow for the body front and the rest was dark green for smaller frog for the larger frog i used navy blue all fabric was scraps an old t-shirt would supply sufficient fabric  hand sewing
